instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display flickering
threads.message:
Hi guys, first post here.

This <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display starts flickering and blinking a few moments before the end of system bar startup running. When the login screen appears, I almost can't see. This is not happening with the external monitor. Tried a new display and the same happens. If I log in and activate the Colors filter, everything works fine again, but the screen gets dark if I don't touch the mouse or keyboard after a few seconds.

After a few days checking this board, I noticed that this flickers starts when vcore drops on both inductors L7310 / L7320. Any Idea?

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display flickering
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> level when problem appers.
There may be corrosion between <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> balls; need to replace it.
Check all traces and adjacent resisors.

Any history available?

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display flickering
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 93732, member: 682"]
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> level when problem appers.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display flickering
threads.message:
Thanks!

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 3.3v stable. Checked on <RESISTOR>R5171</RESISTOR>.
<CHIP>U7701</CHIP> replaced, nothing changed.

No liquid damage, board is nice and clean.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display flickering
threads.message:
The backlight is working good every time, no instability. That was my first guess too. 
The <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> is where things are strange to me. <SIGNAL>CPUVR_FCCM</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>CPUVR_PWM</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CPUVR_PWM1</SIGNAL> are stable until flickering starts.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display flickering
threads.message: I received today another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> today for cleaning and will check differences between boards. The <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> suspect I had is not valid. This one is unstable too, so that's not the problem, it is the normal operation.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display flickering
threads.message:
Do PRAM reset 2-3 times, also SMC reset.
Just in case, disconnect internal SSD and test with known good USB macOS.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display flickering
threads.message:
Made PRAM reset 5 times, also SMC, no news
Tested with known good USB macOS, no news
Tryed to reinstall on a new SSD, impossible. Black screen or image flickering after apple logo.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display flickering
threads.message:
Be sure to use original Magsafe 2 charger.
Problem appears w/ and w/o known good battery connected?
Also test starting in safe mode and SMC bypass.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display flickering
threads.message:
- Used 2 different known good original magsafe 2.
- Yes, it appears w/ and w/o known good battery.
- No news in SMC bypass or safe mode. 

Why that problem "go away" temporally when I enable color filter? What really change on screen? 

This machine is really testing my patience!

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display flickering
threads.message:
Check all resistors and traces around <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>.
Be sure XW7720 is good.

You can try changing video connector; at least clean it.

If external video is OK, shouldn't be iGPU related.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display flickering
threads.message: Thanks for your help, but its taking too much time and I give up. God bless y'all
